name: Minor Scales — Circle of Fifths
description: Natural minor scales following the circle of fifths. Open position keys first, then movable shapes alternating between sharp and flat keys.

steps.name: Am Natural Minor — Open
steps.instructions:
Play the A natural minor scale in open position. Start from open A (5th string) and ascend through the full pattern, then descend. One note per beat.

A minor is the relative minor of C major — same notes, different root.
steps.notes: No sharps or flats. Same notes as C major but starting and resolving to A.

steps.name: Em Natural Minor — Open
steps.instructions:
Play the E natural minor scale in open position. Start from open low E (6th string). Ascend and descend. One note per beat.

E minor is the relative minor of G major: one sharp (F#).
steps.notes: Key signature: F#. The F# appears on the 6th, 4th, and 1st strings.

steps.name: Dm Natural Minor — Open
steps.instructions:
Play the D natural minor scale in open position. Start from open D (4th string). Ascend and descend. One note per beat.

D minor is the relative minor of F major: one flat (Bb).
steps.notes: Key signature: Bb. Notice this pattern is the same shape as F major but with D as the tonal center.

steps.name: Bm Natural Minor — Position 1
steps.instructions:
Play B natural minor using the movable pattern rooted at the 7th fret on the 6th string. This is the standard minor scale shape with the root on the 6th string. Ascend and descend.

B minor is the relative minor of D major: two sharps (F#, C#).
steps.notes: This movable shape works for any natural minor scale. Root on 6th string, 4th string, and 1st string.

steps.name: Gm Natural Minor — Position 1
steps.instructions:
Play G natural minor using the movable shape rooted at the 3rd fret on the 6th string. Same shape as Bm, shifted down 4 frets. Ascend and descend.

G minor is the relative minor of Bb major: two flats (Bb, Eb).
steps.notes: Key signature: Bb, Eb. Notice the Eb on the 2nd string requires a stretch to fret 4.

steps.name: F#m Natural Minor — Position 1
steps.instructions:
Play F# natural minor using the movable shape rooted at the 2nd fret on the 6th string. Ascend and descend.

F# minor is the relative minor of A major: three sharps (F#, C#, G#).
steps.notes: Key signature: F#, C#, G#. Low on the neck — the frets are wider here, good stretch practice.

steps.name: Cm Natural Minor — Position 1
steps.instructions:
Play C natural minor using the movable shape rooted at the 8th fret on the 6th string. Ascend and descend.

C minor is the relative minor of Eb major: three flats (Bb, Eb, Ab).
steps.notes: Key signature: Bb, Eb, Ab. Compare this shape to the Am open position — it's the same pattern, just moved up.
